Package jdraw.framework

Interface DrawToolFactory

  • public interface DrawToolFactory
    A DrawTool factory creates an instance of a draw tool and returns an icon which can be used in the tool palette of the graphics editor.
    Version:
    2.5
    See Also:
    DrawTool

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      DrawTool createTool​(DrawContext context)
      Returns a draw tool operating on the given controller.
      String getIconName()
      Returns the path of the draw tool icon.
      String getName()
      Returns the name of the created tool.
      void setIconName​(String name)
      Sets the path of the draw tool icon to be used for the created draw tool.
      void setName​(String name)
      Sets the name to be used for the created draw tool.

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        String getName()
        Returns the name of the created tool. If this value is not null, then it will overwrite the name of the created tool
        Returns:
        draw tool name
        See Also:
        DrawTool.getName()

      • setName

        void setName​(String name)
        Sets the name to be used for the created draw tool. This name overwrites the name of the draw tool implementation.
        Parameters:
        name - draw tool name

      • getIconName

        String getIconName()
        Returns the path of the draw tool icon. If this value is not null, then it will overwrite the path of the created tool.
        Returns:
        draw tool name
        See Also:
        DrawTool.getIcon()

      • setIconName

        void setIconName​(String name)
        Sets the path of the draw tool icon to be used for the created draw tool. This name overwrites the name of the draw tool implementation.
        Parameters:
        name - draw tool icon name

      • createTool

        DrawTool createTool​(DrawContext context)
        Returns a draw tool operating on the given controller.
        Parameters:
        context - draw context
        Returns:
        draw tool
